instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2179: What is A2179? A2179 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2020 with EMC 3302, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01958..
definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with Internet Recovery failure
threads.message:
This 2020 MacBook Air (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) shows no signs of damage other than a bad battery, which I replaced. It loads Internet Recovery very slowly and, after 20 minutes, always ends with error -2003F. It fails to enter DFU mode (both keyboard method and using <SIGNAL>FORCE_DFU</SIGNAL> pins). So I removed and reflashed the SoC ROM chip (<CHIP>U4770</CHIP>), which allowed me to do a successful DFU Restore. 

However, it still won't load Internet Recovery. It does load Apple Hardware Test which ends with "no issues found". 

Anything recommended to try before I give up on this board?
